annotations.label: Page-header
annotations.text: EN

annotations.label: Page-header
annotations.text: Official Journal of the European Union

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: II

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: (Acts whose publication is not obligatory)

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: COUNCIL

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Whereas:

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (1) The Joint Declaration on Article 39 of Protocol 4 to the EU-Morocco Agreement states that the Community is prepared to examine any request from Morocco for derogations from the rules of origin after signature of the Agreement.
annotations.translation: (1) 关于《欧盟–摩洛哥协定》第 4 号议定书第 39 条的联合声明指出，共同体准备审查摩洛哥在签署《协定》后提出的任何减损原产地规则的请求。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (2) On 19 April 2005, Morocco submitted a request for a derogation from the rules of origin for garments. On 7 June 2005, Morocco completed its request by sending the list of products and relevant quantities, for a total amount of 10 890 tons of garments falling under chapters 61 and 62 of the Harmonised Commodity Description and Coding System.
annotations.translation: (2) 2005 年 4 月 19 日，摩洛哥提交了减损服装原产地规则的申请。2005 年 6 月 7 日，摩洛哥完成了申请，提交了商品名称和编码协调制度第 61 章和第 62 章规定的总量为 10890 吨服装的产品清单和相关数量。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (3) Pending the entry into force of the Morocco-Turkey Free Trade Agreement signed on 7 April 2004 and pending the amendment of the EU-Morocco Protocol on rules of origin, the derogation would allow the manufacture in Morocco of originating garments from fabrics originating in Turkey for export to the Community.
annotations.translation: (3) 在 2004 年 4 月 7 日签署的《摩洛哥–土耳其自由贸易协定》生效之前，以及在修订欧盟–摩洛哥原产地规则议定书之前，该减损将允许在摩洛哥用原产于土耳其的面料制造原产服装并出口到共同体。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (4) This derogation applies also to fabrics originating in Turkey and exported to Morocco from the Community.
annotations.translation: (4) 该减损也适用于原产于土耳其并从共同体出口到摩洛哥的面料。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (5) This derogation will anticipate the effects of a higher degree of cumulation as compared to the one provided for in the current origin protocol, thus contributing to the development of the Moroccan economy, in particular of its textile sector.
annotations.translation: (5)与现行原产地议定书规定的累积相比，该减损预期会产生更高程度的累积效应，从而有助于摩洛哥经济的发展，特别是其纺织业的发展。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (6) Accordingly, this derogation should be granted on the condition that the free trade agreement between Morocco and Turkey, including its protocol on rules of origin, has entered into force.
annotations.translation: (6) 因此，批准该减损的条件是，摩洛哥和土耳其之间的自由贸易协定，包括其原产地规则议定书，已经生效。

annotations.label: List-item
annotations.text: (7) The derogation should be granted until the entry into force of the new protocol on rules of origin among the three Parties concerned, namely Morocco, Turkey and the Community but, in any event, for no longer than a period of one year,
annotations.translation: (7) 在新的原产地规则议定书在摩洛哥、土耳其和共同体这三个有关缔约方之间生效之前，应准予减损，但无论如何，减损期限不得超过一年，

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: HAS DECIDED AS FOLLOWS:

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: Article 1

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: Article 2

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: By way of derogation from Annex II to Protocol 4 to the EU Morocco Agreement, the garments listed in the Annex to this Decision and obtained in Morocco from fabric originating in Turkey shall be considered as originating in Morocco.
annotations.translation: 根据《欧盟摩洛哥协定》第 4 号议定书附件二的减损规定，本决定附件中所列的、在摩洛哥用原产于土耳其的面料制成的服装应视为原产于摩洛哥。

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: The derogation provided for in Article 1 may only be applied provided that preferential rules of origin identical to the rules of origin contained in Protocol 4 to the EU-Morocco Agreement are in force between Turkey and Morocco in order to determine the originating status of the fabrics sourced in Turkey.
annotations.translation: 第 1 条规定的减损仅在土耳其与摩洛哥之间实施与《欧盟–摩洛哥协定》第 4 号议定书所载原产地规则相同的优惠原产地规则，以确定在土耳其采购的面料的原产地地位的情况下方可适用。

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: DECISION No 1/2005 OF THE EU-MOROCCO ASSOCIATION COUNCIL
annotations.translation: 欧盟 – 摩洛哥协会理事会第 1/2005 号决定

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: of 4 August 2005

annotations.label: Section-header
annotations.text: derogating from Protocol 4, concerning the definition of originating products and methods of administrative cooperation, to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Kingdom of Morocco, of the other part
annotations.translation: 关于界定原产地产品和行政合作方法的第 4 号议定书的减损，是在欧洲共同体及其成员国一方与另一方摩洛哥王国之间建立联系的《欧盟–地中海协定》

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: THE EU-MOROCCO ASSOCIATION COUNCIL,
annotations.translation: 欧盟 – 摩洛哥协会理事会，

annotations.label: Text
annotations.text: Having regard to the Euro-Mediterranean Agreement establishing an association between the European Communities and their Member States, of the one part, and the Kingdom of Morocco, of the other part (¹), signed at Brussels on 26 February 1996, hereinafter the 'EU-Morocco Agreement', and in particular Article 39 of Protocol 4 of the Agreement, concerning the definition of originating products and methods of administrative cooperation, thereof,
annotations.translation: 考虑到 1996 年 2 月 26 日在布鲁塞尔签署的《欧盟–地中海协定》，以下称“《欧盟–摩洛哥协定》”，该协定在欧洲共同体及其成员国一方与另一方(¹)摩洛哥王国之间建立了联系，特别是涉及原产地产品的定义和行政合作方法的该协定第 4 号议定书第 39 条，
